name: Copthorne Hotel Birmingham

reviews.text: Needed to book a hotel last minute as I'd failed to prepare well for a friends wedding. Copthorne seemed like good value and thought I couldn't go far wrong. Potential gay guests will be happy to know that it was the most pleasant check in, my partner and I have ever had at a hotel. (You know how awkward it can be...).
reviews.title: Great value - Nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room looked like it was last updated in the early nineties and thus was a little tired, but was spotless and towels and bed sheets fresh and crisp. Windows did a good job of keeping the city noise out, so slept well.
reviews.title: Great Value Great Location

reviews.text: Breakfast was included with our reservation, and was of a good quality, and kept well replenished when we had a late breakfast at 10am.
reviews.title: Central, great staff, few frills

reviews.text: All in all a good value hotel which I'd recommend it to friends and family.
reviews.title: Ideal for everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was great value with breakfast included free (normaly £13.95 per person)
reviews.title: Comfortable stay (apart from the fire alarm!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Copthorne and think it represents excellent value for money. Yes it is getting a bit tired but for around 50 quid a night for two of us with a superb breakfast I can't see what people have to grumble about. The rooms were clean, everything worked and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is excellent with everything you could want within a few minutes walk. No aircon here but enough air with windows open although you can hear some traffic it wasnt enough to disturb us too much.
reviews.title: Can't go wrong for the money!
Tired and run down
reviews.text: We will definitely return to Birmingham in the future and will have no problem staying at the Copthorne again at these sort of rates as leaves us more money to enjoy the rest of what Birmingham has to offer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a frequent visitor to Birmingham attending and exhibiting at the NEC. This is the first time I stayed at the Copthorne. It was just ok. Rooms are tired and in need of fresh decor and furniture which can only be described as functional. Bathroom was small and cramped. We booked the rooms through Hotwire and it only cost £89 for two doubles and you get what you pay for. One of the rooms was facing the Queensway which is a busy and noisy road and as it was a hot night we overheated as it was impossible to leave the window open due to traffic noise. Air conditioning was lacking big time. The TV in the room was of the old CRT variety with basic free view channels. Avoid the bar. We paid nearly £20 for 4 drinks!
reviews.title: A pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is ok for laying your head down for a night or two but not for a holiday as it needs a makeover.
reviews.title: Very good choice for a stay in central Birmingham

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: it's the most unusual hotel location I've encountered to date. It's wedged in the middle of a busy road on what is not very different from the center of a roundabout. Most things you can possibly want in central Birmingham are within a 20 minute walk.
reviews.title: Once we got over the tired furnishings - we enjoyed this hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for one night on a work trip
reviews.title: Have stayed in much worse for the money

reviews.text: Great location for access to the bars and restaurants on Broad Street and an easy walk to the shopping areas
reviews.title: Convenient and functional hotel

reviews.text: The parking is very limited. I had to park in the multi story across the main road which was £8.20 overnight. The machine is outdated and only takes coins so I had to mess around phoning a call centre to pay by card
reviews.title: Ideal Location Good value

reviews.text: My room needed a lick of paint but was clean and comfortable
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: My room on the 2nd floor overlooked the busy main road but the soundproofing was good and I slept well
reviews.title: Staff make this hotel great!

reviews.text: I have visited here for three years whilst at a conference, it is a great location walkable in heels! This time the deterioration in the fabric and decor was very noticeable. Enamel chipped off of the bath, wallpaper patched, at breakfast the wooden detailing on chairs was spilt and lifted. The seat I had looked like the old ragged things that you get in a rundown pub. The Asian themed red paper lanterns make it all seem like a bizarre takeaway.
reviews.title: Tired and run down but great location for conference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hope they do something. It is expensive to stay and travellers who are working hard deserve to be looked after in a clean and contemporary environment.
reviews.title: We liked it

reviews.text: Stayed for two nights over the weekend,we were attending Michael ball concert at symphony hall,hotel was really handy for this venue ,did not have breakfast it's cheaper at weather spoons round the corner.lovely and clean everywhere nice hot shower and comfy beds on complaints at all .
reviews.title: Outdated, overlooking a motorway

reviews.text: The approach to this hotel - over a concrete walkway above a derelict car park full of churning air-conditioning units – was an unfortunately apt herald of doom for my stay.
reviews.title: Good but old fashioned

reviews.text: The first room I was given was on the first floor and looked out at a wall on the other side of a three lane motorway. The room was dim, smelt a little of cigarette smoke, the flimsy bed folded down from the wall and the fittings dated from when the hotel had been built. Worst of all, it had an adjoining door to the adjacent room, so that all that separated me from whoever had chosen to take the room next to mine, was the small lock on my side. I refused point blank to take the room, and if I hadn’t had the room booked through work, would have left the hotel. However, the staff were helpful and found me a better room on the fifth floor. This had slightly brighter and updated fittings, a better view and a proper bed. However ... the shower was jammed on scalding hot, so that at 10.30pm at night, one of the waiters and his friend spent half an hour trying to fix it, and eventually succeeded in jamming the shower to cold/tepid. They'd both done their best, so I didn't have the heart to complain any further.
reviews.title: Paradise Circus??

description: Glass-sheathed contemporary mid-rise hotel in the center of Birmingham, adjacent to International Convention Centre.
